Class Triangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • GeometricFigure
      • Triangle

  • public class Triangle
extends GeometricFigure
    This class represents a two dimensional triangle defined by three point, they represent the triangle's vertices.
    Since:
    13/11/2016
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Andre Pedro, Ricardo Reais, Vasco Carvalho
    See Also:
    GeometricFigure, Point

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Point a
      The triangle vertices.
      private Point b
      The triangle vertices.
      private Point c
      The triangle vertices.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Triangle(Point a, Point b, Point c)
      The creation of a valid triangle implies that the vertices of the triangle must be different points, or else, we would have a line segment or a single point.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected double area()
      Computes the area of the triangle using: |(Ax(By-Cy) + Bx(Cy-Ay) + Cx(Ay-By)) / 2|.
      Point getVerticeA() 
      Point getVerticeB() 
      Point getVerticeC() 
      protected boolean intersects(LineSegment ls)
      Checks if a triangle intersects a line segment, using the intersection between two line segments in all of the triangle's edges.
      protected double perimeter()
      Computes the perimeter of the triangle using: AB + AC + BC.
      void setVerticeA(Point a)
      Defines Triangle's vertice A.
      void setVerticeB(Point b)
      Defines Triangle's vertice B.
      void setVerticeC(Point c)
      Defines Triangle's vertice C.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Triangle

        public Triangle(Point a,
                Point b,
                Point c)
        The creation of a valid triangle implies that the vertices of the triangle must be different points, or else, we would have a line segment or a single point.
        Parameters:
        a - Triangle first vertice.
        b - Triangle second vertice.
        c - Triangle third vertice.

        protected double area()

      • intersects

        protected boolean intersects(LineSegment ls)
        Checks if a triangle intersects a line segment, using the intersection between two line segments in all of the triangle's edges.
        Specified by:
        intersects in class GeometricFigure
        Parameters:
        ls - Line segment to check the intersection.
        Returns:
        True if the triangle and the segment intersect, else false.
        See Also:
        LineSegment.intersects(LineSegment)
